title.narrative: SPI LOCAL GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: By 2025, a child and youth responsive local governance model is institutionalized in selected locations, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children and their families benefit from improved and adequately funded social protection and inclusion systems and enhanced child rights monitoring

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, a child and youth responsive local governance model is institutionalized in selected locations

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to expand and strengthen partnerships with local Governments, including 10 new target locations in which close to 100 professionals from social protection, employment and other relevant social services were mobilized to work on Integrated Case Management and Social Entrepreneurship. In addition, 3 partner Municipalities developed and adopted Social Protection and Inclusion Action Plans, with close to US$100,000 mobilized to enhance delivery of tailored-made social protection services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
